text:
Thomas Bradley Cotter (born September 29, 1970) is an American country music singer. He won the 2004 season of Nashville Star, a talent competition on the USA Network. On the same year, he released his debut album Patient Man. It produced three singles on the Billboard country charts, including the no. 35 "I Meant To".
Early life and career.
Cotter was born in Opelika, Alabama.
